LanguageData.RF.Pylon.NoNetwork: Idle, not connected to power grid.
LanguageData.RF.Pylon.ForceDisabled: Invalid, cannot receive power from '{0}' because there is a sender on the same power grid and channel.
LanguageData.RF.Pylon.ChannelInfoUnsatisfied: Due to insufficuent input, {0} receivers are not getting the power they requested.
LanguageData.RF.Pylon.ConfigureDesc: Change this {0}'s settings, such as what channel to connect to and the amount of power sent or received.
LanguageData.RF.Pylon.DisabledMultipleSelected: Cannot configure multiple {0}s at once. Configure one, and then use the copy-paste buttons.
LanguageData.RF.Pylon.DisabledCopyMultipleSelected: Cannot copy config from multiple {0}s at once.
LanguageData.RF.Pylon.PasteDisabled: Cannot paste config, the clipboard is empty!
LanguageData.RF.Coil.Blocked: Link blocked by {0}, will not fire!
LanguageData.RF.Coil.NotLinked: Not linked, will not fire!\nNote: this coil may be the 'passive' coil.
LanguageData.RF.Coil.LinkDesc: Links this tesla coil to another.\nThis coil becomes the 'active' coil, and the other is 'passive'. Read coil description for more info.
LanguageData.RF.Coil.AlreadyLinked: The target coil is already linked to this one (this one is the 'passive').
LanguageData.RF.Coil.TooFar: The target coil is too far away.
LanguageData.RF.Stats.MadeUsingDesc: This is an alloy that is created at a Forge, using the following materials:
LanguageData.RF.Stats.MeltingPointDesc: The melting point of this material, relevant when trying to make alloys out of it in a Forge.
LanguageData.RF.Stats.UsedToMakeDesc: This resource is needed to make the following alloys at a Forge:
LanguageData.RF.Stats.EquivalentToDesc: Equivalent materials are interchangable in forge recipes. This is done to allow larger mod compatibility, in the cases where other mods add their own version of resources added by RimForge.
LanguageData.RF.Coilgun.AttackDesc: Choose a target and fire at it. WARNING: Firing cannot be cancelled once started!
LanguageData.RF.Coilgun.DisabledNoCaps: Cannot fire: not enough capacitors or not enough energy stored in capacitors.
LanguageData.RF.Coilgun.CapState: Capacitor power: {0}% across {1} capacitors. (req. {2}% to fire)
LanguageData.RF.Coilgun.ChangeShellDesc: Change the type of shell that is loaded into this coilgun. This action ejects the current shell onto the ground, and a colonist will have to load a new one.
LanguageData.RF.Coilgun.DamageReport: The {0} hit {1} objects for a total of {2} damage.
LanguageData.RF.Coilgun.DamageReportStopped: The {0} hit {1} objects for a total of {2} damage, before disintegrated upon hitting {3}.
LanguageData.RF.LR.FailNoPowerNet: Lightning rod caught lightning bolt, but is not connected to a power grid!
LanguageData.RF.LR.FailNoBatteries: Lightning rod caught lightning bolt, but there are no batteries on the power grid! The power was harmlessly passed into the ground.
LanguageData.RF.LR.Success: Lightning rod caught lightning bolt, charging batteries with {0} Wd of power!
LanguageData.RF.Ritual.DrawGuideShowDesc: Enables the ritual structure blueprint guide.\nThis helps you know where to place down the ritual components.
LanguageData.RF.Ritual.DrawGuideHideDesc: Disables the ritual structure blueprint guide.
LanguageData.RF.Ritual.CannotStart_OnCooldown: The ritual cannot be started for another {0} hours.
LanguageData.RF.Ritual.CannotStart_NotNight: The ritual must be performed at night, between 9pm and 3am.
LanguageData.RF.Ritual.CannotStart_NoColonist: An eligible colonist must stand adjacent to the ritual core.
LanguageData.RF.Ritual.StartDesc: Try to start the Blessing of Zir ritual. If there are unmet conditions, they will be listed.
LanguageData.RF.Ritual.Cancelled_PawnMissing: The target colonist went missing, the ritual has been cancelled.
LanguageData.RF.Ritual.Cancelled_SacrificeMissing: The sacrifice died early or went missing. The ritual has been cancelled.
LanguageData.RF.Ritual.Success: The ritual is complete. {0} has been bestowed the Blessing of Zir!
LanguageData.RF.Ritual.QuickGuide: Guide:\nDraft up the colonist to receive the blessing and place them next to this ritual core. Press the Start ritual button, and select a prisoner to sacrifice. If there are any unmet conditions, they will be listed. Otherwise, the ritual will begin.
LanguageData.RF.Ritual.BuildColumnDesc: The ritual requires 8 copper columns to be placed.
LanguageData.RF.Ritual.FailWarning: WARNING: The generosity of the Machine God is not to be taken lightly. The ritual has already been performed {0} before. Attempting to perform the ritual again may incur the wrath of Zir. There is a {1}% chance of failure.
LanguageData.RF.Ritual.FailureMessageMinor: The ritual has gone wrong! You have incurred the wrath of Zir, and {0} has been crippled as a result!
LanguageData.RF.Ritual.FailureMessageMajor: The ritual has gone wrong! You have incurred the wrath of Zir, and {0}'s life has been taken by the Machine God!
LanguageData.RF.LDP.AutoLinkDesc: Automatically link all selected {0}s.\nNote: this will remove all exsting connections.
LanguageData.RF.LDP.AutoLinkDisabled: You need to select multiple {0}s to connect together.
LanguageData.RF.LDP.RemovedLinkRoofBuilt: A roof was built over {0}, so the connection to it has been severed.
LanguageData.RF.LDP.RemovedLinkRoofBuiltSelf: A roof was built over this {0}, so all connections to it have been severed.
LanguageData.RF.Forge.MissingElement: Build at least 1 heating element directly adjacent (left or right) to begin making alloys.
LanguageData.RF.Blessing.IncreasedMessage: Blessing of Zir: Increased quality to {0}
LanguageData.RF.WallConnector.MustPlaceWithFreeSpace: There must be an empty space for the cables to connect to.
LanguageData.RF.Disco.DJArrived: The DJ has arrived. Let's get this party started!
LanguageData.RF.Greenhouse.RoomOutdoors: The greenhouse area is not an enclosed room!
LanguageData.RF.Greenhouse.RoomNotSealed: The greenhouse room does not have a roof.
LanguageData.RF.Greenhouse.RoomTooBig: The greenhouse room is too large. Max size is {0} cells, current size is {1} cells.
LanguageData.RF.Greenhouse.RotateDesc: Adjust the side where this controller will input and output gas (the blue circle). Allows you to build the controller into a wall and target the correct room.
LanguageData.RF.DL.ChangeShellDesc: Change the type of bombs loaded into the drone. Any mortar shell can be loaded as a bomb (81mm in Combat Extended). Any bombs that are already loaded will be safely ejected onto the ground.
LanguageData.RF.DL.TargetDesc: Select a position for a drone strike on this map.
LanguageData.RF.DL.Blocked: Cannot launch, the done is blocked by {0}!
LanguageData.RF.DL.NoShells: Cannot launch, there must be at least 1 shell loaded.
LanguageData.RF.DL.NotEnoughDistance: There is not enough distance between the bombing start and end positions! Click once to select the start position, then move your mouse and click on the end position. There must be at least {0} cells between these two positions.
LanguageData.RF.AC.AlreadyGoodStanding: Your colonists are already in good standing with Machine God Zir.
LanguageData.RF.AC.IncreasedStanding: Your offering has been accepted by the Machine God. Chance of ritual failure has decreased to {0}.
LanguageData.RF.Comps.DeflectDesc: Toggles this weapon's ability to deflect projectiles. Deflecting a projectile will slightly slow down the wielder's movement, so consider turning this off if moving faster is more imporant that not catching a bullet. This weapon's bullet deflection rate is {0}%.
LanguageData.RFS.Header: Hover over the option to show a description. Right-click on an option to reset it to default.
LanguageData.RFS.ShowAdvancedDesc: Shows or hides advanced settings. You should only adjust advanced settings if you know what you are doing!
LanguageData.RFS.UseCustomTab: Add RimForge tab:Enables or disables the RimForge architect tab. Disable this if you already have loads of architect tabs.\nRequires a game restart to take effect.
LanguageData.RFS.GenerateCopper: Generate Copper ore:Enables or disables natural copper ore generation. Requires a new map to take effect.
LanguageData.RFS.GenerateTin: Generate Tin ore:Enables or disables natural tin ore generation. Requires a new map to take effect.
LanguageData.RFS.CableSegmentsPerCell: Power cable resolution:Changes the resolution of power pole's cables. Increasing means smoother cables, but possibly lower performance.
LanguageData.RFS.CableMaxDistance: Power cable range:Changes the maximum distance allowed between power poles. This is personal preference, and does not affect performance.
LanguageData.RFS.CoilgunBaseDamageMultiplier: Base damage multiplier:A multiplier on the base damage of every shell type.
LanguageData.RFS.CoilgunSplatterBlood: Extra gore:Toggles the extra gore and blood splatters when pawns are hit by the coilgun.
LanguageData.RFS.CoilgunDisplayDamageReport: Show damage report:Toggles the message that appears after every coilgun shot, that states hit count and total damage.
LanguageData.RFS.CoilgunPenDamageMultiplier: Penetration damage multiplier:Changes damage dropoff after shells penetrate solid walls. Lower values mean less damage after penetration.
LanguageData.RFS.CoilgunBuildingDamageMulti: Building damage multiplier:Multiplier on the amount of damage that is dealt to buildings (including walls). Does not affect HE shells.
LanguageData.RFS.CoilgunBasePowerReq: Charge per shot multiplier:Multiplier on the amount of capacitor charge required per shot. Lower values mean less capacitors are required.
LanguageData.RFS.TeslaMaxDistance: Max range:The maximum distance, in cells, that is allowed between Tesla Coils. Higher values can affect performance.
LanguageData.RFS.TeslaCooldown: Cooldown:The cooldown of Tesla Coils after firing, measured in ticks. There are 60 ticks in a second.
LanguageData.RFS.TeslaStunDuration: Stun duration:The duration of the Tesla Coils stun effect, measured in ticks. There are 60 ticks in a second.
LanguageData.RFS.TeslaDamage: Damage:The damage dealt by Tesla Coils.
LanguageData.RFS.TeslaTickInterval: Tick interval:Changes the Tesla coils to update every X ticks. Higher values INCREASE performance, but may result in fast-moving raiders being able to slip through the coils undetected.
LanguageData.RFS.TeslaMechanoidDamageMulti: Mechanoid damage multiplier:Tesla Coil damage is multiplied by this value when hitting mechanoids.
LanguageData.RFS.RitualFailCoefficient: Fail chance multiplier:Adjusts the likelyhood of a ritual failing. The first ritual is always successful.
LanguageData.RFS.RitualMustBeAtNight: Night-time only:Toggles the requirement of the ritual needing to be performed at night-time.
LanguageData.RFS.RitualFailMajorChance: Major fail chance:In the event of a ritual failure, this is the chance of the failure killing the colonist, rather than maiming them.
LanguageData.RFS.GreenhouseGrowthAccelerationFactor: Growth acceleration power:Adjusts how powerful the growth acceleration effect is. Higher values are very OP.
LanguageData.RFS.MaxGreenhouseSize: Max size (in cells):Changes the max size that a greenhouse room can be. Higher values can reduce performance quite significantly.
LanguageData.RFS.GreenWattsPerCell: Power requirement per cell:The Watts required per cell in the greenhouse. Personal preference, no affect on performance.
LanguageData.RFS.CursedRaidersNumberScale: Cursed raiders multiplier:A general multiplier on the number of cursed raiders that will appear.\nSet to 0% to disable cursed raiders.
LanguageData.RFS.CursedRaidersNumberMultiplierMin: Cursed raiders per blessed colonist (min):Relative number of cursed raiders per blessed colonist (min).
LanguageData.RFS.CursedRaidersNumberMultiplierMax: Cursed raiders per blessed colonist (max):Relative number of cursed raiders per blessed colonist (max).
LanguageData.RFS.SendRaiderLetter: Send cursed raiders warning letter:Toggles the cursed raider warning letter.
LanguageData.RFS.HateWaveRadius: Wave of Hate radius:Adjusts the radius, in cells, of the Wave of Hate that cursed raiders emmit upon death.\nSet to 0 to disable the Wave of Hate mechanic.
LanguageData.RFS.HateWaveStunDuration: Wave of Hate stun duration:Sets the duration of the stun effect of the Wave of Hate, measured in ticks. There are 60 ticks in a second.\nSet to 0 to disable the stun.
